triples.name: WordNet
triples.relevance: WordNet is a lexical database that organizes words based on psycholinguistic principles, a key resource discussed for lexical representation.

triples.name: Information retrieval
triples.relevance: Information retrieval techniques are applied to lexical acquisition from online resources.

triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: Natural language processing is the overarching field for acquiring semantic lexicons for computational analysis.

triples.name: Machine translation
triples.relevance: Machine translation relies on lexical knowledge to establish the conceptual basis of the lexicon for translating between languages.

triples.name: Word-sense disambiguation
triples.relevance: Word sense disambiguation and tagging are core tasks for processing lexical senses in corpora.

triples.name: Polysemy
triples.relevance: Polysemy represents the capacity of words to have multiple related meanings, addressed when acquiring metaphor-based polysemy in lexicons.

triples.name: Metaphor
triples.relevance: Metaphor-based polysemy is explicitly discussed as a component of lexical semantics acquisition.

triples.name: Lexicon
triples.relevance: Lexicons are the central data structures being acquired through various computational and statistical methods.

triples.name: Corpus linguistics
triples.relevance: Corpus linguistics and corpora are used for tagging word senses and extracting lexical information from textual data.

triples.name: Semantic analysis (linguistics)
triples.relevance: Semantic analysis is fundamental to acquiring semantic lexicons and understanding lexical semantics in natural language.
